original_text: Based on the theoretical analysis, the value of the measuring resistor, Rm, has no effect on the corrosion process and on the estimated value of noise resistance. In order to validate this conclusion, the experiment of Fig. 9 was performed. Specifically, a pair of nominally identical specimens was initially coupled by a 4.7kΩ resistor and their potential with respect to a saturated calomel electrode was recorded by using a NI-USB 6009 analog-to-digital converter. The electrochemical noise signal was recorded using in-house developed software, acquiring at 1023Hz segments of 1000 points at each iteration. Between iterations, the 1000 values acquired were averaged to obtain a single value of potential, subsequently saved to the file used for later processing. The final dataset comprised potential values spaced 1±0.05s in time. Under the assumption that the noise present above 1023Hz is negligible compared with the noise present below 0.5Hz, this procedure enables an accurate recording of the potential noise in the frequencies of interest, avoiding aliasing of frequencies between 0.5 and 1023Hz and minimizing the 50Hz interference from the mains supply.
original_translation: Basado en el análisis teórico, el valor de la resistencia de medición, Rm, no tiene efecto en el proceso de corrosión ni en el valor estimado de la resistencia al ruido. Para validar esta conclusión, se realizó el experimento de la Figura 9. Específicamente, un par de especímenes nominalmente idénticos fue inicialmente acoplado por un resistor de 4.7kΩ y su potencial con respecto a un electrodo de calomel saturado fue registrado utilizando un convertidor analógico-digital NI-USB 6009. La señal de ruido electroquímico fue registrada utilizando un software desarrollado internamente, adquiriendo segmentos de 1000 puntos a 1023Hz en cada iteración. Entre iteraciones, los 1000 valores adquiridos se promediaron para obtener un único valor de potencial, posteriormente guardado en el archivo utilizado para su procesamiento posterior. El conjunto de datos final comprendía valores potenciales espaciados 1±0.05 segundos en el tiempo. Bajo el supuesto de que el ruido presente por encima de 1023Hz es insignificante en comparación con el ruido presente por debajo de 0.5Hz, este procedimiento permite una grabación precisa del ruido potencial en las frecuencias de interés, evitando el aliasing de frecuencias entre 0.5 y 1023Hz y minimizando la interferencia de 50Hz proveniente de la red eléctrica.

Specifically, a pair of nominally identical specimens was initially coupled by a 4.7kΩ resistor and their potential with respect to a saturated calomel electrode was recorded by using a NI-USB 6009 analog-to-digital converter.
The electrochemical noise signal was recorded using in-house developed software, acquiring at 1023Hz segments of 1000 points at each iteration.
Between iterations, the 1000 values acquired were averaged to obtain a single value of potential, subsequently saved to the file used for later processing.
The final dataset comprised potential values spaced 1±0.05s in time.

Under the assumption that the noise present above 1023Hz is negligible compared with the noise present below 0.5Hz, this procedure enables an accurate recording of the potential noise in the frequencies of interest, avoiding aliasing of frequencies between 0.5 and 1023Hz and minimizing the 50Hz interference from the mains supply.

, has no effect on the corrosion process and on the estimated value of noise resistance.

, no tiene efecto en el proceso de corrosión y en el valor estimado de la resistencia al ruido.
